p: Strengthening community participation and provide training on syndromic surveillance for real time reporting, as well as integrating the animal and human health workers teams and building community trust pre, during and post public health emergency at local community and country and global levels [1], [2], [29], [33]. Local and provincial financing targets through a public private partnership strengthening collaboration, coordination and linkage of disease prevention strategies and surveillance efforts among the environment, wildlife, domestic animals and human health sectors benefits, not only from the private sectorsâ€™ resources, but also from their capacities and best practices [29], [33], [34], [35].
